intro: Parosela pilosa, commonly known as the hairy parosela, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring and summer seasons. Parosela pilosa is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
